body.name: FORALL Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Over Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones, Hi-Res Audio, Deep Bass Memory Foam Ear Cups, 40H Playtime for Travel Home Office - Rose Gold

features: √【Active Noise Cancelling Headphones】 Over ear noise cancelling headphones just press the ANC button,it will offer a pure immersive world for you whether in wired or bluetooth mode. Professionally isolate 90% of surrounding noise from aircraft,subways,cars and crowds. (Note:It's NOT 100% noise cancellation. Human talking CAN NOT be elimated and ANC is less effective in quiet environments)

♫【Premium Sound Quality】 Enjoy full-bodied sound with excellent clarity, as our wireless noise cancelling headphones reproduce treble up to 20kHz, elevating your listening experience whether you're working out or enjoying your favorite tunes.
🔋【Long-Lasting Battery Life】 Our noise cancelling headphones stay connected with up to 40 hours of music playback time in ANC mode, ensuring non-stop entertainment throughout your day and night.

📞【Superior Call Quality】 Thanks to the combined built-in microphone with advanced audio signal processing technology.The active noise cancelling headphones deliver a clearer voice quality for all your phone conversations.

🎁【Comfortable & Universal】 Wireless bluetooth headphones feature an adjustable headband,our over-ear headphones are suitable for all people. FORALL bluetooth headset is the most thoughtful gift for family and friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My wife walks around the house with these on and ignores everybody, or the noise cancellation is just that good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good but a little smaller than I thought
reviews.reviewText: Overall a good product with good features for the price but a little smaller in size than I thougjt

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value. Comfortable.
reviews.reviewText: I tried another, similarly priced pair on Amazon and kept these. I think you'd be hard pressed to find anything better at this price point. I like that they fit completely over the ear. I think their "noise cancelling" feature is mostly due to that. I'm a man with a 7-1/2 hat size. I don't find them any more or less comfortable than my wired Bose noise cancelling headphones that are several years old. The Bose cost ten times more. The on/off and volume controls are nicely located. There is a L and R side. Look inside the headband for the L/R. I cannot comment on the battery life. I've worn them for a few hours without any indication that the performance has diminished. Pairing is easy with an audible "pair the device" and "paired." Same for "power on."

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great and is noise cancelling
reviews.reviewText: I've had these headphones for a week now and they sound great. I can connect it to my laptop and everyone can hear me perfectly! So far so good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not powerful sound quality
reviews.reviewText: These are not the ear phones you would get if you want powerful sound bass, it is also not loud enough too. Can't listen to techno with these cause its too low and can't produce the powerful beat noises.But it has noise cancellation button maybe it's not made for listening to techno and other high pitched music.Though comfortable cause its is oval shaped to put ears in and drowns some sound out.But sound quality is just poor so I wouldn't recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent item but not for yard work
reviews.reviewText: I got these as an option for wearing for yard work & noise protection & blue tooth use but after receiving them decided that they are not what they looked like in photos others use for travel or just listening around the house could work fine

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Noise canceling feature stopped working
reviews.reviewText: The headphones are fine I bought these near the end of November and now it's January and the main reason I bought it *for the noise canceling feature* It is not working anymore now whenever I push the noise canceling button instead of canceling noise it is filling my right ear with pressure and a weird noise

reviews.reviewTitle: Teens gave this a ten out of ten
reviews.reviewText: My Teens know a thing or 2 about headphones, and they claim it's by far one of the best, noise cancelling great sound and they look amazing I purchased the black and dark blue they look great arrived quickly great value we will buy again also long lasting charge

Nice headphones in the under $50 club. The sound is smooth, bass is deep. The noise cancelling is so-so but ok. The charge is excellent. As good as headphones two to three times the cost. Overall I would buy again
Comfortable. Soft padding on the ears. The ear pieces swivel which I like to help the comfortability. The battery life is pretty close to 40 hours if you have the volume on average.
Good overall, but I regularly max out the volume when on the subway and can then only just hear it; fine in any quieter situation.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent over-ear headphones, average ANC, reasonably clear voice, comfortable, average bass
reviews.reviewText: These are decent over-ear headphones that appear well-constructed and they are reasonably comfortable to wear (at least for the 2-3 hours during the tests). They certainly LOOK premium (and of course it wouldn't be a fair comparison with $500 ones) and they don't disappoint [much] either. Well, they are as premium as they can get at this price point with the features that they have (which isn't a lot but so is the price so that's that).To start with, the earmuff is average (or just slightly above average) which is a bit disappointing; it could certainly use more cushion but it works just fine. The earcups allow for 90° swivel which is nice and most others at this price point do NOT allow this. They are also foldable which again not all headphones are capable of this which is often puzzling to me (I mean, why not?). The overall build quality is pretty decent without visible defects of any sort. The adjustable headband is easy to work with without any issue and so is the swivel which is very smooth.The usual buttons (power and volume +/- etc) are located at the back side of the earcup at the right. It can be charged via standard USB-C which is nice.Pairing is a snap (as they all should at this point in time) and the overall sound quality for highs and lows are above average; not great but more than adequate for the average consumers. The bass is equally decent although it's a bit boomy at times and it's probably not gonna be as impressive for those who prefer more emphasis toward the lower frequencies. They don't have any of the low latency or HD codecs such as aptX-LL or aptX-HD which is expected for headphones at this price range.Unfortunately, they don't have cVc 8.0 although they do claim to have ANC (more on that) but it's important to remember that cVc benefits the party that doesn't have one (i.e. it's for the other end of the conversation) while ANC usually helps with the party that has it. So cVc helps the people that you talk to by reducing the noise on your end when you are talking. In other words, if you find it difficult to hear your friends when they are in a noisy environment, it's not because noise cancellation doesn't work, it's only at they NEED cVc (or other protocols that do what cVc does) on their end. If the noise is on your end, then you'd need ANC for your headphones.So how do they perform with respect to calls? Well, it really depended on the environment that I was in. My voice appeared fairly clear as reported by the other party when I was in a relatively quiet place; however, the voice quality drastically worsened when artificial noise was introduced at my end (e.g. lower frequency fan noise).Unfortunately, the ANC didn't appear to work adequately for me either when I was in a relatively noisy environment (artificial ambient noise and fan). As a result, I was having a difficult time understanding the other party at times and that's a bit disappointing since it does advertise being having ANC of sorts although it's not clear to me exactly what it is, hybrid or not.≡ ValueLet me be clear - these ain't some earth-shattering over-ear headphones that's gonna blow your mind (and VERY far from it); however, these are in my opinion a decent enough and quite capable at this particular price point of $40 that provides adequate lows/bass and reasonably decent highs/mids with somewhat comfortable earmuffs. Unfortunately, they don't have cVc and ANC doesn't appear to work as expected which is a bit of a boo-boo. I can't speak about longevity for obvious reasons but I'll provide an update if and when that changes.
